ICDThematicWord: Other specified diseases with participation of lymphoreticular and reticulohistiocytic tissue.Other histiocytosis syndromes
definitionCn: HISTIOCYTES增殖引起的婴儿和儿童的良性疾病,组织中发现的巨噬细胞。 这些组织细胞,通常是含脂质的非朗格汉斯细胞,通常在皮肤,眼睛,有时在内脏中形成多个黄色 - 红色结节。 患者似乎具有正常的脂质代谢并被归类为正常血浆非朗格汉斯细胞组织细胞增多症
definitionEn: Benign disorder of infants and children caused by proliferation of HISTIOCYTES, macrophages found in tissues. These histiocytes, usually lipid-laden non-Langerhans cells, form multiple yellow-red nodules most often in the skin, the eye, and sometimes in the viscera. Patients appear to have normal lipid metabolism and are classified as a normolipemic non-Langerhans cell histiocytosis
Pathogeny: The etiology of JXG is unknown, but a genetic basis has been suggested given the multiple sites of occurrence. However, familial cases have not been observed.
DifferentialDiagnosis: Juvenile variety xantogranuloma can be distinguished from xanthoma by the spread of the lesion and the lack of lipid abnormalities. Other similar diagNOSes include molluscum contagiosum, hemangioma and neurofibroma.
CTImageDescription: CT scanning and MRI are rarely indicated.
MRIImageDescription: CT scanning and MRI are rarely indicated.
DifferentialDiagnosisInCN: 幼年型黄色肉芽肿可以通过病灶扩散和血脂异常缺乏与黄色瘤区别开来。 其他类似的诊断包括传染性软疣,血管瘤和神经纤维瘤。
PathogenyInCN: JXG的病因尚不清楚,但鉴于多发性部位,已提出遗传基础。 但是,没有观察到家族病例。
